title: JSON schema for ESLint configuration files

oneOf.description:
ESLint rule

0 - turns the rule off
1 - turn the rule on as a warning (doesn't affect exit code)
2 - turn the rule on as an error (exit code is 1 when triggered)

ESLint rule

"off" - turns the rule off
"warn" - turn the rule on as a warning (doesn't affect exit code)
"error" - turn the rule on as an error (exit code is 1 when triggered)

no-cond-assign.description: Disallow assignment operators in conditional expressions

no-control-regex.description: Disallow control characters in regular expressions

no-dupe-args.description: Disallow duplicate arguments in function definitions

no-dupe-keys.description: Disallow duplicate keys in object literals

no-empty-character-class.description: Disallow empty character classes in regular expressions

no-ex-assign.description: Disallow reassigning exceptions in catch clauses

no-inner-declarations.description: Disallow function or var declarations in nested blocks

no-invalid-regexp.description: Disallow invalid regular expression strings in RegExp constructors

no-irregular-whitespace.description: Disallow irregular whitespace outside of strings and comments

no-negated-in-lhs.description: Disallow negating the left operand in in expressions (deprecated)

no-obj-calls.description: Disallow calling global object properties as functions

no-prototype-builtins.description: Disallow calling some Object.prototype methods directly on objects

no-regex-spaces.description: Disallow multiple spaces in regular expressions

no-template-curly-in-string.description: Disallow template literal placeholder syntax in regular strings

no-unreachable.description: Disallow unreachable code after return, throw, continue, and break statements

no-unsafe-finally.description: Disallow control flow statements in finally blocks

no-unsafe-negation.description: Disallow negating the left operand of relational operators

use-isnan.description: Require calls to isNaN() when checking for NaN

valid-typeof.description: Enforce comparing typeof expressions against valid strings

accessor-pairs.description: Enforce getter and setter pairs in objects

array-callback-return.description: Enforce return statements in callbacks of array methods

block-scoped-var.description: Enforce the use of variables within the scope they are defined

complexity.description: Enforce a maximum cyclomatic complexity allowed in a program

consistent-return.description: Require return statements to either always or never specify values

curly.description: Enforce consistent brace style for all control statements

default-case.description: Require default cases in switch statements

dot-location.description: Enforce consistent newlines before and after dots

guard-for-in.description: Require for-in loops to include an if statement

no-alert.description: Disallow the use of alert, confirm, and prompt

no-caller.description: Disallow the use of arguments.caller or arguments.callee

no-case-declarations.description: Disallow lexical declarations in case clauses

no-div-regex.description: Disallow division operators explicitly at the beginning of regular expressions

no-else-return.description: Disallow else blocks after return statements in if statements

no-eq-null.description: Disallow null comparisons without type-checking operators

no-floating-decimal.description: Disallow leading or trailing decimal points in numeric literals

no-global-assign.description: Disallow assignments to native objects or read-only global variables

no-implicit-globals.description: Disallow var and named function declarations in the global scope

no-implied-eval.description: Disallow the use of eval()-like methods

no-invalid-this.description: Disallow this keywords outside of classes or class-like objects

no-iterator.description: Disallow the use of the __iterator__ property

no-loop-func.description: Disallow function declarations and expressions inside loop statements

no-new.description: Disallow new operators outside of assignments or comparisons

no-new-func.description: Disallow new operators with the Function object

no-new-wrappers.description: Disallow new operators with the String, Number, and Boolean objects

no-octal-escape.description: Disallow octal escape sequences in string literals

no-proto.description: Disallow the use of the __proto__ property

no-return-assign.description: Disallow assignment operators in return statements

no-self-assign.description: Disallow assignments where both sides are exactly the same

no-self-compare.description: Disallow comparisons where both sides are exactly the same

no-useless-concat.description: Disallow unnecessary concatenation of literals or template literals

no-warning-comments.description: Disallow specified warning terms in comments

radix.description: Enforce the consistent use of the radix argument when using parseInt()

require-await.description: Disallow async functions which have no await expression

vars-on-top.description: Require var declarations be placed at the top of their containing scope

wrap-iife.description: Require parentheses around immediate function invocations

strict.description: require or disallow strict mode directives

init-declarations.description: Require or disallow initialization in var declarations

no-catch-shadow.description: Disallow catch clause parameters from shadowing variables in the outer scope

no-label-var.description: Disallow labels that share a name with a variable

no-shadow.description: Disallow var declarations from shadowing variables in the outer scope

no-shadow-restricted-names.description: Disallow identifiers from shadowing restricted names

no-undef.description: Disallow the use of undeclared variables unless mentioned in /*global */ comments

no-undefined.description: Disallow the use of undefined as an identifier

no-use-before-define.description: Disallow the use of variables before they are defined

global-require.description: Require require() calls to be placed at top-level module scope

no-mixed-requires.description: Disallow require calls to be mixed with regular var declarations

no-new-require.description: Disallow new operators with calls to require

no-restricted-modules.description: Disallow specified modules when loaded by require

array-bracket-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing inside array brackets

block-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing inside single-line blocks

brace-style.description: Enforce consistent brace style for blocks

capitalized-comments.description: Enforce or disallow capitalization of the first letter of a comment

comma-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after commas

computed-property-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing inside computed property brackets

consistent-this.description: Enforce consistent naming when capturing the current execution context

eol-last.description: Enforce at least one newline at the end of files

func-call-spacing.description: Require or disallow spacing between function identifiers and their invocations

func-names.description: Require or disallow named function expressions

func-style.description: Enforce the consistent use of either function declarations or expressions

id-length.description: Enforce minimum and maximum identifier lengths

id-match.description: Require identifiers to match a specified regular expression

jsx-quotes.description: Enforce the consistent use of either double or single quotes in JSX attributes

key-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing between keys and values in object literal properties

keyword-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after keywords

max-depth.description: Enforce a maximum depth that blocks can be nested

max-lines.description: Enforce a maximum number of lines per file

max-nested-callbacks.description: Enforce a maximum depth that callbacks can be nested

max-params.description: Enforce a maximum number of parameters in function definitions

max-statements.description: Enforce a maximum number of statements allowed in function blocks

max-statements-per-line.description: Enforce a maximum number of statements allowed per line

multiline-ternary.description: Enforce newlines between operands of ternary expressions

new-cap.description: Require constructor function names to begin with a capital letter

newline-after-var.description: Require or disallow an empty line after var declarations

newline-before-return.description: Require an empty line before return statements

newline-per-chained-call.description: Require a newline after each call in a method chain

new-parens.description: Require parentheses when invoking a constructor with no arguments

no-lonely-if.description: Disallow if statements as the only statement in else blocks

no-mixed-spaces-and-tabs.description: Disallow mixed spaces and tabs for indentation

no-trailing-spaces.description: Disallow trailing whitespace at the end of lines

no-unneeded-ternary.description: Disallow ternary operators when simpler alternatives exist

object-curly-newline.description: Enforce consistent line breaks inside braces

object-property-newline.description: Enforce placing object properties on separate lines

one-var.description: Enforce variables to be declared either together or separately in functions

one-var-declaration-per-line.description: Require or disallow newlines around var declarations

operator-assignment.description: Require or disallow assignment operator shorthand where possible

operator-linebreak.description: Enforce consistent linebreak style for operators

padded-blocks.description: Require or disallow padding within blocks

quote-props.description: Require quotes around object literal property names

quotes.description: Enforce the consistent use of either backticks, double, or single quotes

semi.description: Require or disallow semicolons instead of ASI

semi-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after semicolons

sort-keys.description: Requires object keys to be sorted

sort-vars.description: Require variables within the same declaration block to be sorted

space-before-function-paren.description: Enforce consistent spacing before function definition opening parenthesis

spaced-comment.description: Enforce consistent spacing after the // or /* in a comment

space-unary-ops.description: Enforce consistent spacing before or after unary operators

unicode-bom.description: Require or disallow Unicode byte order mark (BOM)

arrow-body-style.description: Require braces around arrow function bodies

arrow-parens.description: Require parentheses around arrow function arguments

arrow-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after the arrow in arrow functions

generator-star-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing around * operators in generator functions

no-confusing-arrow.description: Disallow arrow functions where they could be confused with comparisons

no-new-symbol.description: Disallow new operators with the Symbol object

no-restricted-imports.description: Disallow specified modules when loaded by import

no-this-before-super.description: Disallow this/super before calling super() in constructors

no-useless-computed-key.description: Disallow unnecessary computed property keys in object literals

no-useless-rename.description: Disallow renaming import, export, and destructured assignments to the same name

no-var.description: Require let or const instead of var

object-shorthand.description: Require or disallow method and property shorthand syntax for object literals

prefer-const.description: Require const declarations for variables that are never reassigned after declared

prefer-rest-params.description: Require rest parameters instead of arguments

prefer-template.description: Require template literals instead of string concatenation

Require-yield.description: Require generator functions to contain yield

rest-spread-spacing.description: Enforce spacing between rest and spread operators and their expressions

sort-imports.description: Enforce sorted import declarations within modules

template-curly-spacing.description: Require or disallow spacing around embedded expressions of template strings

yield-star-spacing.description: Require or disallow spacing around the * in yield* expressions

ecmaFeatures.description: By default, ESLint supports only ECMAScript 5 syntax. You can override that setting to enable support for ECMAScript 6 as well as JSX by using configuration settings.

experimentalObjectRestSpread.description: Enables support for the experimental object rest/spread properties (IMPORTANT: This is an experimental feature that may change significantly in the future. It’s recommended that you do not write rules relying on this functionality unless you are willing to incur maintenance cost when it changes.)

globalReturn.description: allow return statements in the global scope

impliedStrict.description: enable global strict mode (if ecmaVersion is 5 or greater)

env.description: An environment defines global variables that are predefined.

amd.description: defines require() and define() as global variables as per the amd spec

commonjs.description: CommonJS global variables and CommonJS scoping (use this for browser-only code that uses Browserify/WebPack)

shared-node-browser.description: Globals common to both Node and Browser

es6.description: enable all ECMAScript 6 features except for modules

jasmine.description: adds all of the Jasmine testing global variables for version 1.3 and 2.0

mocha.description: adds all of the Mocha test global variables

node.description: Node.js global variables and Node.js scoping

extends.description: If you want to extend a specific configuration file, you can use the extends property and specify the path to the file. The path can be either relative or absolute.

globals.description: Set each global variable name equal to true to allow the variable to be overwritten or false to disallow overwriting.

ignore.description: A list of file paths/globs that eslint should ignore

parserOptions.description: The JavaScript language options to be supported

ecmaVersion.description: Set to 3, 5 (default), 6, 7, or 8 to specify the version of ECMAScript you want to use. Alternatively, set to 2015 (same as 6), 2016 (same as 7), or 2017 (same as 8) to use year-based naming.

sourceType.description: set to "script" (default) or "module" if your code is in ECMAScript modules

plugins.description: ESLint supports the use of third-party plugins. Before using the plugin, you have to install it using npm.

rules.description: ESLint comes with a large number of rules. You can modify which rules your project uses either using configuration comments or configuration files.

settings.description: ESLint supports adding shared settings into configuration file. You can add settings object to ESLint configuration file and it will be supplied to every rule that will be executed. This may be useful if you are adding custom rules and want them to have access to the same information and be easily configurable.
